results:
I purchased this as part of the DVD 10 pack CURSE OF THE DEAD, which is a great deal. While the films in this collection may not have been fully remastered or restored, and they are presented in full-frame pan and scan format, there are still some hidden gems to be found. And by "gems," I mean there are some enjoyable films, especially if they are from the '70s like The Mansion of Madness.

My copy of the film is titled Mansion of Madness, but when the title screens appear, it says Poe's Dr. Tarr's Torture Dungeon. However, the title doesn't really matter because bad is bad, right? Yes! But to say that this film is completely worthless would be untrue. There are some unique elements scattered throughout, and it's clear that the filmmakers had a decent budget.

The opening title sequence is actually quite cool, with its colored negative effect that gives it a cheap TV look. The dialogue is always laughable. In the beginning of the film, the horse and buggy driver gets out to move a dead tree stump on the road, and Our Hero exclaims, "WHAT STRENGTH!" Funny enough, this same guy later struggles to fend off the wacky woodsmen when they come to cause chaos. You'll almost forget that he was even in the movie until he reappears near the end. That's how forgettable these characters are.

However, the best part of Mansion of Madness has to be the wacky music and silly antics that the protagonists have to endure. It's like the kind of bad cartoon music that a three-year-old would enjoy. And why all the bizarre slapstick humor? My favorite moment has to be when the horse and buggy is ambushed by the forest freaks, who use a ridiculous-looking homemade ghost on a stick to stop the buggy. What on earth? Oh, and there are plenty of gratuitous nudity scenes for those who are interested. Boobies, bad dialogue, and wacky music. That pretty much sums up Mansion of Madness for me. It's definitely worth watching at least once, and it might even be more enjoyable if you have a few drinks or something. I can't say I was ever bored while watching it, but I also can't deny that it's a bit of a mess. It's like Magical Mystery Tour, but with a plot, yet not really. Hmm.

And Mr. Chicken is the best!

The opening title sequence is cool with its colored negative run through a cheap TV look. The dialogue is always hilarious. Funny, then, that this dude should later not be able to fight off the wacky woodsmen when they come to make freaky fun. You'll completely forget that this guy was even in the movie until he crops up again later near the end. That's how memorable these characters are.

The best part about Mansion of Madness, however, has to be the wacky music and screwball hijinks that the good guys have to endure. It's well worth at least one viewing, and may be a lot better if you've had a few to drink or whatnot. I can't say I was ever bored watching it, but I can't deny that it's also a barrel of poop. Kinda like Magical Mystery Tour but with a plot, but not. Hmm.
